subclass.name: Exalted Assembly of the Feline Court
subclassFeatures: Exalted Assembly of the Feline Court|Warlock|XPHB|Feline Court|CthulhuTorchlight|3

subclass.name: Path of the Spell Scorned
subclassFeatures: Path of the Spell Scorned|Barbarian|XPHB|Spell Scorned|CthulhuTorchlight|3

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Spell Scorned

entries: My magic? It's the magic of stabbing things in the face. Works well in my experience.
entries.from: Oreg the Slayer

entries: The Path of the Spell Scorned awakens a mote of antimagic within the soul of its adherents. These elite warriors steel themselves against magical effects. Some are specially trained bodyguards, tasked with protecting the elite mages of arcane academies or the high priests of religious orders. Others are demon hunters, their resistance allowing them to overcome the foul magic that strikes down lesser warriors.

subclassFeature.name: Instinctual Divination
entries: You gain an intuitive sense about the supernatural facets of the world. When you take the {@action Study|XPHB} action to make an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB}) or Intelligence ({@skill Religion|XPHB}) check, you can make it as a Wisdom ({@skill Survival|XPHB}) check instead.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Hammer
entries: You sheathe your weapons in crackling energy that is particularly baneful to creatures from other worlds, those that wield magic, or those that are capable of tremendous destruction. Once per turn while your Rage is active, you can deal double your Rage Damage bonus to a target you hit with a Strength-based attack. If the target has Legendary Actions, can cast spells, or was summoned, you can deal triple your Rage Damage bonus instead.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Shield
entries: You exert a void around you that consumes spells. While your Rage is active, you radiate a spell-consuming aura in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} that originates from you. You and your allies in the aura gain a bonus to saving throws against spells equal to your Rage Damage bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Sunder the Weave
entries: You always have the {@spell Counterspell|XPHB} spell prepared. With this feature, you can cast it without a spell slot or components while your Rage is active, and your spellcasting ability for it is Strength. As part of the {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} you take to cast the spell, you can move up to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and make one attack with a weapon against the target of the spell.
Once you cast the spell with this feature, you can't do so in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Bolstering Howl
entries: When you or another creature that can hear you takes damage, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to grant it {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} against that damage. In addition, the target gains {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to that damage type until the end of the current turn.

subclassFeature.name: Dimensional Duel
entries: You always have the {@spell Banishment|XPHB} spell prepared. When you activate your Rage or as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while your Rage is active, you can cast {@spell Banishment|XPHB} without a spell slot or components and while your Rage is active, and your spellcasting ability for it is Strength. You can maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} while your Rage is active. You can target up to three creatures when you cast {@spell Banishment|XPHB} this way. In addition, you can choose to pursue the creatures you banish. If you do so, the targets you banished don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition for the spell's duration, and you travel with them to a demiplane. The demiplane is an empty room 30 to 200 feet in each dimension (you choose when you cast the spell) and made of wood or stone (your choice). You must create enough space for you and the targets, or the spell ends. The room is filled with {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB}. When the spell ends, if you traveled with any targets, you and any dropped objects reappear in the space you left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Strength modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: College of Drama

entries: All the world's a stage,
And all the men and women merely players.
They have their exits and their entrances;
And one man in his time plays many parts.
entries.from: William Shakespeare

entries: Bards tell tales in a variety of ways. Some sing. Some dance. But it is through art they share the sagas of ancient days. Bards of the College of Drama take a deeper approach to bringing the old stories to life. With a combination of skill and magic, they alter not only their own appearance and voice but that of an entire troupe.

By becoming characters from legend, these Bards inspire greatness in those who witness their performances. They rally their allies to impossible feats of perseverance, reminding their friends that the heroes of old faced worse and carried through to victory.

Bards who adopt this specialization are particularly adept at infiltrating evil organizations. Their magic allows their entire party to take on a role, giving the group the opportunity to blend in during a ritual or take part in a large gathering.

subclassFeature.name: One Life, Many Roles
entries: You use your magic and dramatic training to step into a role. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cast {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB} with this feature. If you take on the appearance of a specific creature you can see when you cast {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB} in this way, you can adopt that creature's mannerisms and voice.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Tragic Hero
entries: A great performance sometimes comes at a cost to the artist. If you fail a saving throw, choose other creatures you can see within 60 feet of yourself. Each of the chosen creatures gains a bonus to saving throws equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1) against the same effect that triggered this feature, potentially turning a failure into a success.

subclassFeature.name: Stage Direction
entries: You gain the ability to direct others as you inspire them, allowing them to make the most of your guidance. When a creature that can see you would normally roll one of your Bardic Inspiration die, don't roll the die; instead use the highest number possible for the die.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Assemble the Troupe
entries: When you cast {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB} using your One Life, Many Roles feature, you can target up to six willing creatures you can see within 30 feet of you with the {@spell Disguise Self|XPHB} spell. You choose the appearance each creature takes. While under the effects of the spell cast with this feature, the chosen creatures gain a bonus to Charisma checks equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Grand Finale
entries: You gain the ability to deliver a stirring performance that spurs your companions to mighty deeds. As a Magic action, choose up to two other creatures within 60 feet that can see or hear you. Each of the chosen creatures can immediately take an action this turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Apocalypse Domain

entries: Some say the world ends in fire. Others, ice. I'm ready for both.
entries.from: Endara, Doom's Daughter

entries: Few gods embrace the Apocalypse Domain, yet in times of war, disease, or social upheaval, its Clerics appear at the head of grim cults that proclaim the world's imminent demise. Devotes of the Apocalypse Domain are usually apostates and heretics cast from religious orders for their fanatical conviction to the end of all things.

The exact origin of their divine power confounds the elders of established religions. Sometimes, these Clerics derive their powers from the gods of fate, doom, or change. More often, though, they seem to draw their power from the collective gloom of a population facing disaster. Perhaps the world's demise is truly imminent, and these visionaries have found some way to tap into the apocalypse as it grows near.
{@b Alignment}

Consider your alignment and how it dictates your attitude toward the apocalypse. Below are some ideas on how your philosophy shapes your attitudes and religious practices. You can also use this table to determine the nature of your cult.

rows: Each of us faces the apocalypse alone. We must find our own path to making peace with the imminent destruction of all we hold dear. In these end times, laws, traditions, and restrictions mean nothing. We are entitled to live as we see fit.

The apocalypse is at hand, but if you obey the dictates and commandments determined by your order, you have the chance to escape. The gods will preserve those who are worthy, and you will know the worthy by their observance to the proper traditions, rites, and sacrifices.

All things die, including the world. By cataloging the end times, perhaps we can preserve a sliver of our reality for whatever world arises from the ashes. But make no mistake—when the world ends, we will end with it.

It isn't enough for the apocalypse to come to the world-we must hasten its appearance by culling those foolish enough to defy it. By doing so, the force behind the coming disaster will welcome us as its instruments and preserve us after we end this world.

The apocalypse is a cleansing event, one that will see the wickedness of the world washed away in favor of a new order. Our task is to spread knowledge of the righteous path. We must be patient and kind, for few wish to hear our message. But those wise enough to embrace our hymn will join us in the paradise to come.

subclassFeature.name: Apocalypse Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Apocalypse Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Apocalypse Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Darkness|XPHB}, {@spell Hellish Rebuke|XPHB}, {@spell Phantasmal Force|XPHB}, {@spell Thunderwave|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Doom Song
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to hasten a creature's doom. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use your Channel Divinity to choose a creature you can see within 120 feet of yourself. For 10 minutes, attack rolls against the creature can score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

subclassFeature.name: Visions of Annihilation
entries: You gain the ability to foretell a creature's doom. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose a creature you can see within 120 feet of yourself. Until the start of your next turn, attack rolls against that creature have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: All Will Be Dust
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to twist a creature's fate. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your Channel Divinity to choose a creature you can see within 120 feet of yourself. That creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next saving throw it makes against your spells before the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Life Beyond Death
entries: When you or an ally within 120 feet of you is about to make a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB}, you can expend a spell slot (no action required) to heal the target a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to ten times the level of the spell slot expended.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Symbiote

entries: Steel and magic come and go. Nature abides.
entries.from: Lerex the Justifier

entries: Druids typically view themselves as caretakers of the natural world, using their magic to maintain the wild realms. Druids of the Circle of the Symbiote take this a step further. They become part of nature, allowing plants to take root in their flesh and become an integral part of their being.

Druids of this circle are sometimes seen as extremists by their brethren. They treat plants and animals as equals, seeing intelligent creatures as no more worthy of respect or protection than other living things. At their most extreme, these Druids wage war against civilization, calling on fang and vine to topple those who would invade the natural world and subvert it.

These Druids, owing to their close bonds to the natural world, are drawn to face the horrid invaders of the Cthulhu Mythos. They see themselves as the wild's first line of defense against these abominations.

entries.caption: Symbiote Appearance
rows: Your symbiote wishes to remain hidden. It slides into the folds of your clothes and seeks to avoid detection.

To an observer, your symbiote looks like a flower that you have tucked over your ear or into your hair. However, a closer examination reveals roots that have bored through your skull and into your brain.
Your symbiote lives just under the surface of your skin, forming a spiderweb pattern of roots and vines. Those who observe you for a time can see these roots shifting and moving.

Your symbiote has replaced your hair, leaving you with a flowing mass of vines spilling to your shoulders. During the winter, the tendrils wither to a dull brown color. In the summer, they burst with colorful blooms.

Your symbiote has replaced a limb, forming a sinuous tangle of woody roots woven like rope. This limb is as strong and flexible as your original, but it places some strange demands on you. Instead of drinking, you must dip your limb in water to slake your thirst.

Your symbiote grows deep within your chest, its vines looping between your organs and reaching to touch beneath your skin. Short, sharp thorns stud parts of your body. To sustain your symbiote, you must skewer chunks of raw flesh on these thorns. Your symbiote draws nutrients from this meat.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Symbiote Spells
entries: When you reach a Druid level specified in the Circle of the Symbiote Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Symbiote
entries: Vines and roots grow across your body, forming a symbiotic network. As it draws physical and magical nourishment from you, the symbiote grants you a number of benefits.

entries.name: Fortifying Presence
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

entries.name: Symbiotic Transformation
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of Wild Shape to allow your symbiote to transform you into a plant-like brute as fibrous plates and vines cover your skin. For 1 minute, you gain a +2 bonus to AC, you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to 2 plus half your Druid level (round down) at the start of each of your turns, and you gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks.

subclassFeature.name: Symbiotic Reflexes
entries: Your plant symbiote empowers you. You always have the {@spell Haste|XPHB} spell prepared. Once per active Symbiotic Transformation, you can cast {@spell Haste|XPHB} on yourself without a spell slot or components.

subclassFeature.name: Survival Instinct
entries: While you are in mortal peril, your symbiote can attempt to move you to safety. While you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, you can take the {@action Dash|XPHB}, {@action Disengage|XPHB}, or {@action Dodge|XPHB} action, and you retain the benefits of the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action while you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Surge of Sustenance
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend one use of Wild Shape to grant the benefits of finishing a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} to yourself or a creature you touch.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Hero

entries: In times as dark as these, all it takes is one spark to bring back the light.
entries.from: Hector Arghast, Champion of Ten Banners

entries: Entities of the Cthulhu Mythos are terrifyingly implacable and utterly inhuman. While those traits often make such creatures unbeatable, their inability to understand humanity's capabilities can prove their undoing. Heroes are Fighters who bring out the best in humanity. They are the beacons of hope rallying commoners against a shared threat. While their blades are deadly to their enemies, their words are encouragement to their allies, and their unflappable demeanor allows their companions to find the courage and strength they never knew they had.

subclassFeature.name: Bolstering Presence
entries: At the start of your turn, you can bolster your allies (no action required). Creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 2d6} plus half your Fighter level (rounded down). You can't use this feature if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Heroic Effort
entries: You can seize the moment and turn the tide. You can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} at the end of a creature's turn to move up to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and make one attack with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. Then one ally of your choice within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you can also move up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and make one attack with a weapon or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} using its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Lead by Example
entries: If you are {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, or {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} when you use your Heroic Effort feature, the condition ends on you. In addition, if the ally you target with Heroic Effort is {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, or {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, the condition ends on it.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Presence
entries: When you use your Bolstering Presence feature, each of the chosen creatures gains a bonus to {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} and damage rolls equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1) until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Durable Presence
entries: You now regain all expended uses of your Bolstering Presence feature when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Mighty Effort
entries: When you use your Heroic Effort feature, you can now target up to two additional creatures, instead of only one.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of Cosmic Balance

entries: When the cosmos spins out of alignment, my job is to kick it back into place. Literally.
entries.from: Sheresa, Acolyte of the Vast

entries: Warriors of the Cosmic Balance watch the mystic paths of the world, the dimensional portals and arcane gates. And where eldrtich horrors seek to intrude upon the world, these warriors stand waiting. They are trained to use their inner power to purge even the strongest afflictions, and their merest touch can send the mightiest abominations back to the horrid pits that spawned them.

entries.subclassFeature: Guardian of the Way Technique|Monk|XPHB|Cosmic Balance|CthulhuTorchlight|3

subclassFeature.name: Guardian of the Way Technique
entries: You have studied alien creatures and learned to disrupt the foul energies that course through them. Once per turn when you make an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} with Flurry of Blows and deal damage, you can cause one of the following effects:

items.name: Anchoring Strike
entries: Until the end of your next turn, the target can't teleport or use planar travel, including, entering an extradimensional space or demiplane.

items.name: Banishing Strike
entries: The target teleports up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

subclassFeature.name: Seeker
entries: You always have the {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} and {@spell Comprehend Languages|XPHB} spells prepared. With this feature, you can cast one of the spells without a spell slot or components, and your spellcasting ability for it is Wisdom.

Once you cast the spell with this feature, you can't do so in this way again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you expend 1 Focus Point (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Warden of Harmony
entries: When a creature within 60 feet of you attempts to teleport, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and spend 1 Focus Point to prevent the teleportation.

subclassFeature.name: Cosmic Restoration
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can touch a willing creature (which could be yourself) and choose one of the following options.

entries.name: Dispelling Touch
entries: You end all spells of your choice currently affecting the target.

entries.name: Purging Touch
entries: You remove one of the following conditions from the target: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} (decreases by 1), {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Petrified|XPHB}, {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, or {@condition Stunned|XPHB}.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending 4 Focus Points (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Ward the Profane
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can expend 3 Focus Points to cast {@spell Banishment|XPHB} targeting that creature. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

subclassFeature.name: Defensive Intervention
entries: When a creature you can see hits another creature within 30 feet of you with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and expend one use of your Channel Divinity to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space within range of the triggering attack and become the target of the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Marking Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack roll using a weapon, you can forgo using that weapon's mastery property to mark the target until the end of your next turn. This effect ends early if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition or if someone else marks the creature. A marked creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against targets other than you, and it must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving away from you.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Guardian

entries: The first step to killing an eldritch horror: don't die.
entries.from: Miranda of the Unbroken Shield

entries: These Paladins serve as protectors of the common folk and guards against rampaging monsters. Those who embrace this oath range from itinerant Paladins who single-handedly defend towns on the borderlands to elite groups of knights tasked with protecting the cardinals of a religious order.

entries.name: Tenets of the Guardian
entries: Like any Paladin oath, the ethos embraced by specific Paladins or the order they belong to shapes their beliefs. Listed below are sample tenets for the various alignments. Create your specific tenets by picking up to four ideals that capture your views.
{@b Tenets of Chaos}

items.name: Affinity
entries: You protect and help those you feel meet your personal standards.

items.name: Beauty
entries: Violence is nihilistic; protect the beautiful and precious instead.

items.name: Freedom
entries: Tyrants use violence to oppress. You deny that power.
{@b Tenets of Evil}

items.name: Dominance
entries: Let others believe you protect them so you can rule them.

items.name: Opportunism
entries: Protect others while it profits you. Strike when they weaken.

items.name: Profit
entries: Guard the wealthy as long as they pay. Join the mob when they fall.
{@b Tenets of Good}

items.name: Courage
entries: Stand firm in the face of danger.

items.name: Sacrifice
entries: Suffer for others so they may flourish.

items.name: Service
entries: Use your strength to serve those who need help most.
{@b Tenets of Law}

items.name: Fidelity
entries: Keep your oath above all.

items.name: Protection
entries: Guard civilization to preserve order.

items.name: Service
entries: Follow your code to protect others, even in complex duties.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Guardian Spells
entries: The magic of your oath ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of the Guardian Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Oath of the Guardian Spells
rows: {@spell Beacon of Hope|XPHB}, {@spell Protection from Energy|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Guarding Presence
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can choose creatures within 5 feet of yourself, up to a number of creatures equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature). Each of the chosen creatures can use your AC instead of its own AC as long as it remains within 5 feet of you or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Defense
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} action. In addition, creatures of your choice under the effects of your Guarding Presence can attack twice instead of once whenever they make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Ward of the Guardian
entries: When a creature marked by you that you can see reduces an ally to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and doesn't kill the ally outright, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to have the ally drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead. If you do so, the ally can immediately take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to make a melee attack against the marked creature if it's within reach.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian Angel
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you become a living bastion of defense, granting the benefits below for 1 minute or until you end them (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

entries.name: Walking Bastion
entries: Your Guarding Presence becomes a 100-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. Creatures of your choice within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} can use your AC.

entries.name: Endless Divinity
entries: On each of your turns, if you have no uses of Channel Divinity left, you can give yourself one use.

entries.name: Supreme Punishment
entries: You can use Ward of the Guardian without taking a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} once each round. When you do so, you can't use it this way again until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Coordinated Tactics
entries: You have an innate understanding of coordinating teamwork. It is represented by your Teamwork Die, which is used in the powers you have from this subclass. The Teamwork Die table shows the die size when you reach certain Ranger levels.
At the start of your turn, roll your Teamwork Die and use that result for it until the start of your next turn when you reroll it.

entries.name: Coordinated Strikes
entries: When another creature you can see hits a target with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll your Teamwork Die and add the number rolled to the attack's damage against the target. The damage is of the same type dealt by the original attack.

entries.name: Coordinated Tactics
entries: You grant your allies the ability to harmonize their positions on the battlefield. At the start of your turn, after you roll your Teamwork Die you can choose any number of willing creatures within 60 feet of you that can see you. Each of the chosen creatures can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to a number of feet equal to 5 times the number rolled or up to its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, whichever is lower. This movement doesn't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks} and ignores {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Lead the Way
entries: When you make an ability check with a skill proficiency in which you have {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} and succeed, you can choose other creatures within 60 feet of yourself. Until the start of your next turn, each of the chosen creatures gains a bonus to the same check equal to a roll of your Teamwork Die.

subclassFeature.name: Trail Warden

entries: Wanting to become a hero is a noble aim, but no one remembers the guy who died of dysentery on his way to the dungeon.
entries.from: Hilda Farwander

entries: Trail wardens are Rangers who have taken an oath. When they lead others into the wilderness, they swear to bring them back safe and sound, but they aren't mere bodyguards or tour guides. Trail Wardens only lead those they deem capable of providing the skills and abilities needed to endure the horrid monsters and grinding conditions of an expedition. Far from civilization's protective grasp, there is no room for dead weight. A single mistake can cost the lives of an entire party.

Trail Wardens are known for their harsh attitude toward others. Some Trail Wardens believe that they must bring the realities of the wilderness into civilization to prevent the careless from joining their expeditions and endangering the group. But once in the wilds, they become nurturing, protective, and insightful as they guide their charges safely through dangerous territory.

subclassFeature.name: Trail Warden Spells
entries: When you reach a Ranger level specified in the Trailwarden Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Assault
entries: Your ability to direct the movement and attacks of your allies improves.
Each ally you choose with your Coordinate Tactics feature that can see or hear you gains one of the following benefits of their choice.

entries.name: Guardian Maneuver
entries: Until the start of your next turn, the first time the ally takes damage, they can reduce the damage taken by the number rolled on your Teamwork Die.

entries.name: Recon Maneuver
entries: When an ally takes a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move, it can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action as part of that {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}. It gains a bonus to the Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) check equal to the number rolled on your Teamwork Die.

subclassFeature.name: Coordinated Effort
entries: When you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, you can roll your Teamwork Die if you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition; you and each ally within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you gains a bonus to {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} equal to the number rolled.

subclassFeature.name: Group Assault
entries: You coordinate your allies in their attacks against a powerful foe. If you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action and each attack you make is against the same target, you can choose other creatures within 60 feet of yourself. Each of the chosen creatures gains a bonus to one attack roll and damage roll equal to the number rolled on your Teamwork Die against the same target.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Stalker

entries: Some folk keep to the shadows. I bring them with me wherever I go.
entries.from: Kulden

entries: Rogues are at home in the shadows, slipping into the darkness to evade their enemies, strike down unsuspecting foes, or carry off great treasures. Some Rogues feel a strange presence when they slip into the darkness, whispers at the edge of their hearing.

These Rogues hear the call of the shadow, and they are fated to become bound. The darkness can sense a void in a creature's heart, a yearning that can never be filled. Or perhaps it can. The shadows reach out with a simple offer: yield something of your past and open a path to a future where your empty heart is filled. Those who hear this offer are doomed to accept it, and they are doomed to regret it. Yet, the shadow chooses its partners carefully, knowing that those marked for its bargain can't resist.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Motes
entries: You have the power to control shadows, which is represented by your Shadow Motes. You can expend these motes to enhance or fuel certain Shadow Stalker features. You have an amount of motes equal to your Rogue level. You start knowing three such features: Shadow Scout, Shadow Swap, and Vexing Shadow, each of which is detailed below. When you expend a Shadow Mote, it is unavailable until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, at the end of which you regain all your expended motes. You also regain 1 expended Shadow Mote when you reduce a {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Shadow Scout
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend 1 Shadow Mote to project your senses through your Shadowy Reflection. For 1 minute, you can see and hear through it as if you were located where it is, and you can move it up to 120 feet away from you. This effect ends early if you take any damage or if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Shadow Swap
entries: When you use your Cunning Action feature, as part of that {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend 1 Shadow Mote to swap places with your Shadowy Reflection. You teleport to its space, and it teleports to your space. If you appear in an occupied space, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take Force damage equal to the number of feet you are moved.

entries.name: Vexing Shadow
entries: Immediately after you hit a creature with an attack roll using a weapon and your Shadowy Reflection is within 5 feet of that creature, you can expend 1 Shadow Mote to gain the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition against that creature until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Shadowy Reflection
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you expel your shadow from your side and command its actions. It appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you and is your size. The Shadowy Reflection can manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an unattended item, or pour out a vial. As a Magic action on your later turns or as part of the {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} when you use your Cunning Action feature, you can control your shadow again. You can move your shadow up to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. The shadow can't attack, active magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds. Your shadow disappears when it takes any damage, is the target of any effect, or if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Shadowed Succor
entries: You can weave shadows to intercept an attack and direct it harmlessly into a void of darkness. When you use your Uncanny Dodge feature, you can reduce the attack's damage against you to 0.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Gate
entries: Your Shadowy Reflection can create an umbral pathway that you and your companions can use. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while your Shadowy Reflection is within 5 feet of you, you can expend 4 Shadow Motes to cast {@spell Dimension Door|XPHB}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it. Your Shadowy Reflection can travel through the spell.

subclassFeature.name: True Shadow
entries: Your Shadowy Reflection gains the ability to become a deadly clone of you. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, your Shadowy Reflection transforms into an exact duplicate of you.

For 1 hour, your Shadowy Reflection becomes substantial, and you can have it take the {@action Attack|XPHB}, {@action Hide|XPHB}, or {@action Utilize|XPHB} action by controlling it with your Shadowy Reflection feature. Its {@action Attack|XPHB} action uses your game statistics, including class features, feats, and weapons. It vanishes when reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.
When you make an attack roll against a creature within 5 feet of the duplicate, the attack roll has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Hungering Dark

entries: When you tell us to fear the dark, it isn't to protect us, but to keep us under control.
entries.from: Veldeth, Scion of Midnight

entries: When Sorcerers first manifest their abilities, they sometimes describe the experience as a slumbering portion of their identity awakening, a sudden understanding of their true nature.

Other Sorcerers aren't so fortunate. The magic within claws at their souls and pushes at their mind. It is like a hungry beast, always ravenous, never satisfied despite desperate efforts. These poor spellcasters are living gateways to a realm of darkness and gloom, a place said to serve as the source of all undead.

Sorcerers of the Hungering Dark are conflicted victims of their own power. They wield mighty spells, but, by using their magic, they create a bridge that allows horrid creatures to step into this world, even if for only a moment.

subclassFeature.name: Innate Darkness Spells
entries: When you reach a Sorcerer level specified in the Innate Darkness Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Innate Darkness Spells
rows: {@spell Confounding Shadows|CthulhuTorchlight}, {@spell Darkness|XPHB}, {@spell Tide of Darkness|CthulhuTorchlight}, {@spell Umbral Tendril|CthulhuTorchlight}
{@spell Evard's Black Tentacles|XPHB|Black Tentacles}, {@spell Greater Invisibility|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Shadowed Soul
entries: The darkness within allows you to push away the light. You gain {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB}, its range increases by 60 feet. In addition, you can see through any magical {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB} you create with your Innate Darkness feature, unless you have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} or {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Friends to Darkness
entries: When you cast any spell from your Innate Darkness feaure, you can choose a number creatures up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature). A chosen creature can see through any magical {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB} you create for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Pure Darkness
entries: When you cast any spell from your Innate Darkness feature that creates an area of {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}, {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} and {@sense Blindsight|XPHB} can't see within the area of the spell.

subclassFeature.name: One with Darkness
entries: The darkness within you roils with hunger and transforms you. You exist in a shadowy state between reality and darkness. On your turn, you have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition and can't be perceived by {@sense Truesight|XPHB} or {@sense Blindsight|XPHB}. You can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see but only if you haven't moved during this turn, and after you use it, your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 until the end of the current turn.

subclassFeature.name: Exalted Assembly of the Feline Court

entries: If man could be crossed with a cat, it would improve man but deteriorate the cat.
entries.from: Mark Twain

entries: The entities of the Cthulhu Mythos have many enemies. Not all who learn of these terrible creatures fall victim to their promises of forbidden power. Across the cosmos, a grand conspiracy consisting of the most unlikely of creatures.

A court of intelligent house cats seek to protect the world from the Mythos. Hailing from across planes, worlds, and planets, they use magic and manipulation to ensure that their centuries of work domesticating humans remains uninterrupted. For all their skill at providing food, warmth, and shelter, humans are all too prone to corruption, meddling in powers far beyond their grasp. All it takes is one fool with a forbidden book and generations of work crumbles as yet another human civilization falls to dust.
The Exalted Assembly of the Feline Court coordinates efforts to sustain and protect their servants. They forge magical pact with those who show the right mix of cunning, bravery, and etiquette.

subclassFeature.name: Feline Affinity
entries: You gain the ability to speak with the world's true nobility. You can cast {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB} without expending a spell slot. When you cast the spell this way, the only Beasts you can verbally communicate with are cats, though most cats are reluctant to converse with a creature as simple as you.

subclassFeature.name: Feline Form
entries: Your patron takes pity on you and gives you the ability to adopt a superior, more pleasing form. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you shape-shift into a Cat, a Tiny Beast. You stay in that form for a number of hours equal to half your Warlock level (rounded down) or until you use this feature again, have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, or die. You can also leave the form early as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. While in this form, you retain your personality, memories, and ability to speak, and the following rules apply:

entries.name: Game Statistics
entries: Your game statistics are replaced by the Beast's stat block, but you retain your creature type; {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}; {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; class features; languages; and feats. You also retain your skill and saving throw proficiencies and use your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} for them, in addition to gaining the proficiencies of the creature. If a skill or saving throw modifier in the Beast's stat block is higher than yours, use the one in the stat block.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries: While in your cat form, you can only casts spells that are on your Feline Spells feature. You can cast these spells without needing Material components. In addition, if you have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition from the {@action Hide|XPHB} action and cast a spell that doesn't target a {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} creature, you retain the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition. Shapeshifting doesn't break your {@status Concentration|XPHB} or otherwise interfere with a spell you've already cast.

entries.name: Equipment
entries: You choose whether your equipment falls in your space, merges into your new form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal, but the DM decides whether it's practical for your Tiny Beast form to wear a piece of equipment. Your equipment doesn't change size or shape to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can't wear must either fall to the ground or merge with the form. Equipment that merges with the form has no effect while you're in that form.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Feline Spells
entries: The magic of your patron ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Warlock level specified in the Feline Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Feline Spells
rows: {@spell Animal Friendship|XPHB}, {@spell Cat's Spring|CthulhuTorchlight}, {@spell Feather Fall|XPHB}, {@spell Feline Grace|CthulhuTorchlight}, {@spell Misty Step|XPHB}, {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Vexing Distraction
entries: While in your cat form, you can pass off the most destructive, distracting, and irritating behavior as cute or even adorable.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while in your cat form, choose a creature within 5 feet of you that can see and hear you. The target must succeed on a Wisdom save against your spell save DC or be affected by one of the following effects of your choice:

items.name: Annoy
entries: The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Confound
entries: The target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced to 0 until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Distract
entries: A creature of your choice has {@variantrule Cover|XPHB|Total Cover} against the target until the end of the chosen creature's next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Nine Lives
entries: You are gifted with an almost inexplicable ability to survive dangerous situations. You have Nine Lives, which can be expended in the following ways:

items: If you take damage while you have 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can expend 1 life to not suffer a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB} failure. If the damage is from a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}, you must expend 2 lives to not suffer {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB} failures.
If you are forced to make a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB}, you can expend 1 life to cause yourself to succeed instead.
If you are forced to make a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB}, you can expend 5 lives to turn the roll into a 20.
If you would die from massive damage, you can expend 1 life to be reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} instead of being killed outright.
When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and not killed outright, you can expend 1 life to drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead.
If you are targeted with an effect that causes instant death, such as a {@spell Power Word Kill|XPHB} spell, you can expend 9 lives to ignore the effect.

entries: You regain all expended lives when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Summon the Courtiers
entries: Having served the Feline Assembly with grace, tact, and good taste, you have earned their favor. When you take damage from a creature that is within 60 feet of you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to call upon the Assembly's wrath. A horde of hissing, spectral cats emerges from the planar firmament and descends upon the creature that damaged you. That creature takes {@damage 5d10} Force damage and has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Prone|XPHB} conditions until the end of your next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} unless you spend a Pact Magic spell slot (no action required) to restore your use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Bibliomancy

entries: Books are a uniquely portable magic.
entries.from: Stephen King

entries: A spellbook is a Wizard's prized possession. Even the least experienced apprentice knows that each spell's formula must be carefully recorded, understood, and memorized to cast a spell properly. For the typical Wizard, the symbols, words, and equations in a spellbook are a means to an end.

For Bibliomancers, the language of magic is the key to the building blocks of the universe. This tradition believes that a spell's formula holds more than the gathering and shaping magical energy, that the underlying properties of reality itself are illustrated through a spell. By unlocking the mechanisms that construct spells, these Wizards can slowly unlock the riddle of the universe.

subclassFeature.name: Book Learning
entries: You have an arcane connection to all books, be they tablets or tomes, allowing you to unravel their secrets. If you touch an object containing a script for 1 minute, you learn a basic, working knowledge of the script's contents unless that information is hidden by a code or cypher. If the book or script is a magic item or magical object, you learn its properties and how to use it, whether it requires {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB}, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any ongoing spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn that spell's name.

subclassFeature.name: Edit Spell
entries: Choose a spell in your spellbook that is level 1 or higher. When you prepare that spell, you can give it one or more the following benefits:

items: The spell save DC of your spells increases by 1.
If that spell deals damage, you can change that damage's type to a different one of your choice.
If that spell requires a saving throw, you can change that saving throw to Intelligence.

entries: You can prepare the chosen spell multiple times, choosing different benefits for each preparation. Each modified version of the spell counts against your prepared spells.
When you make these changes, you can alter the spell's name. For example, {@spell Burning Hands|XPHB} changed to deal Cold damage and require an Intelligence saving throw might be named Mind Freeze.

When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change your chosen spell. When you change the chosen spell, the benefits to the previous chosen spell end and you no longer have the altered versions prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Weaver of Words
entries: You become a master of all words. You learn all languages available to characters in the campaign.

subclassFeature.name: Customized Spell
entries: You can alter the structure of a spell to incorporate a creature's name. Pick a spell in your spell book that has a Verbal component, requires {@status Concentration|XPHB}, and is level 1+. When you prepare that spell, you can name a specific, willing creature other than yourself. If that creature is the only target of the spell, you can cast the spell on it without needing to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Words
entries: When you prepare spells, pick two spells from levels 1 to 5 to weave into a linked, powerful spell you can prepare as a single spell. The level of the linked spell is equal to the combined level of the two spells chosen and can't exceed 6.
The chosen spells must have a Verbal component and must have a casting time of one action.
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can cast the linked spell, and the effects of both spells occur at the same time.

items.name: Ability Scores:
items.entry: Increase an ability score by 2 and another one of your choice by 1, or increase three different ability scores by 1. None of these increases can raise a score above 20.

items.name: Skill Proficiencies:
items.entry: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: You gain proficiency with one tool of your choice.

feat.name: I Fought, I Lived
entries: You confronted a horror from beyond this world or spawned by terrible magic. It disregarded you as a puny mortal, but it learned its mistake the hard way when you sent it back to wherever it came from with good, old-fashioned muscle, courage, and a really, really large axe.
You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Defiant Strike
entries: While you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} and hit with a spell or weapon attack, you can choose to treat the attack's damage roll as having rolled the maximum damage possible. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Indomitable Heart
entries: If you have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition at the start of your turn, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 10 or higher, you no longer have that condition.

feat.name: I Hid from the Terror
entries: That night is a blur. A strange presence, an overwhelming terror, and a confused jumble of screams mixed with faint memories of something terrible and hungry. You hid from it, finding a place too small for it to reach. The sounds of that night, and the awful aftermath you found that morning, will remain with you to the end of your days and beyond.
You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Shadowed Strike
entries: If attacking would end the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition on you, you can make an attack and keep that condition. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. You regain expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Beneath Notice
entries: When you attempt to hide from a creature that is larger than you, you can hide if you are lightly obscured or more than 30 feet away from it. You gain the benefits of being hidden against such creatures, but you do not hide from other creatures.

entries.name: Merge into Shadows
entries: Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks made to detect you while you have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

feat.name: I Opened the Gate
entries: You didn't mean for things to turn out this way. You were curious and perhaps ignored a few signs, but it's hard to take ancient curses seriously. Musty old books say a lot of things, and most of them turn out to be mere fables. Most of them. The one book you read turned out to be the key to unleashing some ancient evil. Now it's in the world, and it's up to you to find it and send it back.
You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Delver into Forgotten Lore
entries: You learn three languages of your choice.

entries.name: Foul Arcana
entries: You can tap into a brief glimpse of the mythos to empower a spell, at the cost of overwhelming your mind with a horrifying, cosmic insight. When you cast a spell, you can give that spell's save DC a +2 bonus but you have the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition until the start of your next turn. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. You regain expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: I Pierced the Illusion
entries: You came across something strange and awful, made all the more terrible by its hidden nature. A town might have seemed innocent until it dragged unwitting visitors to their carefully tended sacrificial garden, or the family that took you in on a dark, stormy night were actually hungry cannibals. You survived because you saw their disguise and escaped or struck first.
You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Clear Senses
entries: If you have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition at the start of your turn, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 10 or higher, you no longer have that condition.

entries.name: Ear for Falsehood
entries: When an NPC speaks to you, you can use this ability to determine if they are lying. You learn nothing about the truth they conceal or why they are lying, simply that there is a knowing falsehood in their statement. You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. You regain expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Subtle Interrogation
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Insight checks made against creatures that you are speaking with.

feat.name: I Survived to Tell the Tale
entries: You encountered something dreadful, a horrible creature or bizarre ritual that set you down the path to becoming an investigator of the strange. Your quick feet and instinct for survival carried you through that day and are your best assets.
You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Instinct to Survive
entries: When you take damage that would reduce you to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can immediately regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your level. When you use this benefit, you cannot use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Superior Speed
entries: You gain a +10 bonus to {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Wriggle Free
entries: If you would gain the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 10 or higher, you instead do not gain it.

spell.name: Body Warping of Gorgoroth
entries: Choose a Humanoid of your size that you can see in range. You physically transform to become an exact duplicate of that creature for the duration. Even a thorough physical examination fails to find any differences between you and the target.
Your voice and equipment don't change.

spell.name: Breath of the Deep
entries: You conjure sea water from the deepest trench to surround a creature that you can see within range. The water seeps into the target's mouth and around its body, slowly crushing it with the unfathomable weight of the sea. The target takes {@damage 3d6} Bludgeoning damage and is unable to talk for the duration or use the verbal components of spells.

spell.name: Call Deity
entries: You can cast this spell only during the duration of a Contact Deity spell you also cast. You cause the deity you contacted to manifest in the nearest unoccupied space. For 1 hour, it acts as it wishes but treats you as an ally if you don't take actions against it. It doesn't extend this courtesy to your allies and interprets your attempts to protect others as acting against it.

spell.name: Cat's Spring
entries: You jump up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space you can see and deliver a spectral claw attack that deals Slashing or Force damage (you choose when you cast the spell). Make a melee spell attack against a target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} damage of the chosen type, and the next attack roll you make against it before the end of your next turn has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 (38), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Chant of Thoth
entries: The first time you fail an Intelligence check during the spell's duration, you may automatically succeed on the check if the DC is less than your spell save DC. Otherwise, you gain a +2 bonus to that check. Once you use this benefit, you cannot use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.

spell.name: Clutch of Darkness
entries: You create a terrible force that slowly crushes the target from the inside. Choose a creature that you can see within range and roll {@dice 2d6} and record the total rolled. At the start of each of your turns, roll another {@dice 2d6} and add the number rolled to the total.
If the total is greater than the target's Strength, it has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Strength-based attacks.
If the total is greater than the target's Dexterity, its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved and attack rolls against it have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.
If the total is greater than its current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the target immediately implodes and dies.

spell.name: Confounding Shadows
entries: You create an orb of writhing shadows and hurl it at a creature within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage and it is unable to see you until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d6}), 11 ({@dice 3d6}), and 17 ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Contact Deity
entries: You contact a deity of the Cthulhu Mythos. You can ask the entity {@dice 1d6} questions that can be answered with yes or no. You must ask your questions before the spell ends. You receive a correct answer for each question. Old Ones aren't necessarily omniscient, so you might receive "unclear" as an answer if a question pertains to information that lies beyond the Old One's knowledge. In a case where a one-word answer could be misleading or contrary to the Old One's interests, the GM might offer a short phrase as an answer instead.

When you cast this spell, roll a {@dice d20}. If you roll a 1, the deity appears in the nearest unoccupied space and attacks creatures (including you) in the area for the spell's duration before returning to its realm.

spell.name: Create Mist of R'lyeh
entries: R'lyeh is an ancient city cloaked in a horror-filled mist. You tap into that dreadful mist to create a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of fog centered on a point within range. The {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} is {@variantrule Lightly Obscured|XPHB}. Strange, fleeting shapes are visible within it. A creature that ends its turn in the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} takes {@damage 1d4} Psychic damage. Beast creatures with an Intelligence of 3 or less refuse to enter the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} willingly.

spell.name: Curse of the Putrid Husk
entries: You create a horrid illusion in the target's mind, convincing it that its body is slowly decaying. One creature that you can see in range is overcome with a sense of impending doom as it watches itself rot. Choose one of the following effects.

A creature selflessly tries to prevent the disease from spreading to its allies. Whenever it starts its turn within 30 feet of an ally, it takes the {@action Dash|XPHB} action and moves away from its nearest ally by the safest route unless there is nowhere to move.

A creature becomes filled with spite as it tries to spread the disease to its enemies. It takes the {@action Dash|XPHB} action and moves toward its nearest enemy by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. When an enemy is within 5 feet of it, it makes an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} against that target.

spell.name: Dismiss Deity
entries: You exert the natural order of the cosmos and force a Mythos entity back from whence it came. Choose a {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} Mythos or Deity creature that you can see within range. The target is transported to a random location on a plane (GM's choice) associated with its creature type.

spell.name: Doom
entries: You whisper a prophecy of imminent death, and these words slip into the threads of a creature's fate and cause it to pull toward the moment of its death. One creature that you can see within range makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when the creature takes damage from an attack. Don't roll the attack's damage dice for the damage. Instead use the highest number possible for each damage die. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

spell.name: Dread Curse of Azathoth
entries: You utter the secret name of Azathoth and doom a creature to an inevitable death unless it breaks the spell. The creature gains a curse point at the end of each of its turns. When the creature gains its third curse point, it dies. It loses all curse points when the spell ends.

spell.name: Dust of Suleiman
entries: You conjure a cloud of fine dust that harms supernatural creatures. You create a 30-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of dust centered on a point within range. Choose a creature type other than Beast or Humanoid. Each creature of the chosen type within the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} take 20 Force damage. A creature also takes this damage when the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} moves into its space and when it enters the {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} or ends its turn there. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

spell.name: Evil Eye
entries: You glare at a creature that you can see within range, imposing a baleful hex on it. The target takes {@damage 1d4 + 2} Psychic damage, and attack rolls and {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} against it can score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d4 + 2} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d4 + 4}), 11 ({@dice 3d4 + 6}), and 17 ({@dice 4d4 + 8}).

spell.name: Feline Chaos
entries: Each target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration. An affected target takes {@damage 4d6} Slashing damage at the start of each of their turns, and they have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on all ability checks and attack rolls. If they attempt to move, they must make a Constitution saving throw or gain the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, taking another {@damage 2d6} Slashing damage from the startled cats. At the end of their turn an affected creature makes another Dexterity saving throw, ending the spell on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage at the start of an affected target's turns increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Feline Grace
entries: You gain the unerring reflexes and balance of a cat. Until the spell ends, you gain the following benefits:
You are immune to the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition while you don't have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, as you always land on your feet.
You can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you fall to reduce any damage you take from the fall by an amount equal to five times your level.
You gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity checks and saving throws.
Your jump distance is doubled.

spell.name: Fist of Yog-Sothoth
entries: You conjure a horrid tendril of Yog-Sothoth into reality to batter your foe. One creature of your choice that you can see within range makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 8d6} Necrotic damage, has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition, and you move it up to 40 feet in any direction within the spell's range. On a successful save, it takes {@damage 8d6} Necrotic damage only.

spell.name: Phantom Panther
entries: You conjure a spectral panther that pounces on a creature you can see within range, mauling and pinning it for your allies close in for the kill.

The target makes a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 8d6} Force damage and has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the spell ends. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only, and the spell ends. While {@condition Restrained|XPHB}, the target takes {@damage 2d6} Force damage at the start of each of its turns. The target or a creature within reach of it can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check against your spell save DC. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Red Sign
entries: You reach above your head and conjure the dreaded Red Sign, a sigil of immense power that is inimical to all creatures. At the end of each of your turns for the duration, each creature (including yourself) within 30 feet of you that can see you takes {@damage 5d8} Necrotic damage. This damage can't break your {@status Concentration|XPHB}. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it and everything nonmagical it is wearing and carrying collapses into a pile of slime and viscera. The target can be revived only by a {@spell True Resurrection|XPHB} or a {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell.

spell.name: Shadowy Eruption
entries: A 20-foot radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} of gloom erupts from a point you choose within range as fell energies from the dimension of shadow flood the area. You select an entity to push through into this reality for a horrifying moment. When you cast this spell, choose one of the following options:

items.name: The Darkness Hides Terrors
entries: Creatures of your choice in the area must make Dexterity saving throws. A target takes {@damage 4d8} Psychic damage on a failed save and must use a reaction to move as far away as it can from the point you chose, using the safest route. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

items.name: Tomb of Shadows
entries: Creatures of your choice in the area must make Constitution saving throws. A target takes {@damage 4d8} Necrotic damage on a failed save and its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced by 20 feet. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Summon Shadow
entries: You call forth a spirit of shadow. It manifests as a silhouette of pure blackness in an unoccupied space you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the {@creature Shadow Spirit|CthulhuTorchlight} stat block. When you cast this spell, choose Infiltrator or Assassin. Your choice determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Tide of Darkness
entries: You unleash a wave of swirling shadows that fills an area next to you. Each creature in a 10-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} of {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB} originating from you when you cast the spell makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} Psychic damage and is {@condition Blinded|XPHB} until it is no longer in the area of {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition Blinded|XPHB}. The {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB} lasts until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The size of the {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} increases by 5 feet for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Umbral Tendril
entries: You create a long tendril of life-stealing shadow that lashes out at a creature in range that you can see.
Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit the target takes {@damage 2d8} Necrotic damage and you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the damage dealt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Voorish Sign
entries: You have mastered the Voorish sign, a sigil from an ancient era said to predate the world's creation. Choose a creature that you can see within range. When you would normally roll one or more dice to deal damage to that creature with a spell, don't roll those dice for the damage; instead use the highest number possible for each die. In addition, you can choose a spell of level 5 or lower that you can cast, that has a casting time of an action. You can cast that spell as part of casting Voorish Sign, expending spell slots for both.

spell.name: Wave of Oblivion
entries: You create a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} of oblivion. Each {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} creature in the {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature dies, and it and everything nonmagical it is wearing and carrying are turned to dust. The target can be revived only by a {@spell True Resurrection|XPHB} or a {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell.

item.name: Book of Dzyan
item.reqAttune: by a DC 20 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB} check)
entries: This strange tome is reputed to have been originally penned by the first human civilization that long ago disappeared beneath the rising seas. It grants its bearer insights needed to peer into secretive realms, at the cost of a growing suspicion of others.

entries.name: Language:
entries: {@language Celestial|XPHB}.

entries.name: Attunement Check:
entries: Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB}) DC 20. To end your attunement to the Book of Dzyan, a demon or devil must cast {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} on you. The book then disappears in a flash of light.

entries.name: Benefits:
entries: While attuned to the Book of Dzyan, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can see {@condition Invisible|XPHB} creatures and objects within 30 feet of you.
You can read and write {@language Abyssal|XPHB} and {@language Infernal|XPHB}.

If you can cast spells, you always have {@spell Guidance|XPHB}, {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB}, {@spell Locate Object|XPHB}, {@spell Fly|XPHB}, {@spell Divination|XPHB}, {@spell Contact Deity|CthulhuTorchlight}, and {@spell Call Deity|CthulhuTorchlight} prepared.
Simply touching a wall or object allows you to detect secret doors or similar hidden compartments built into that object within 5 feet of you.

You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on all Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) checks. If your check result is a 20 or higher, you learn a secret about a creature. This benefit applies only once for a given creature.
The save DC of your spells gains a +1 bonus.

entries.name: Drawbacks:
entries: When you encounter a creature you have never seen before, roll a {@dice d20} at the start of each of your turns. On a 10 or higher, you can only use your action that turn to {@action Study|XPHB} it and learn about it. Once you do so, you no longer need to make this roll when that creature is present. This drawback applies to a general type of creature. If you encountered a {@creature Hydra|XMM} this drawback would apply, but it would not affect you when encountering different {@creature Hydra|XMM|Hydras} in the future.

entries.name: Insight-Insatiable Curiosity (+15):
entries: You cannot bear to think that there are secrets out there that are beyond your grasp. A closed door, a parchment covered with strange runes, or anything else that holds a secret is an irresistible lure to you.

entries.name: Lore:
entries: The Book of Dzyan allows you to automatically succeed all DC 25 or lower checks made to learn about creatures of the planes.

item.name: Fingerprint Kit

items.name: Ability:
entries: Intelligence

items.name: Utilize:
entries: Reveal the fingerprint left behind on an object and sketch a copy (DC 20), or match a copied fingerprint against a humanoid creature's (DC 15).
This item allows you to capture the details of a fingerprint that has been left on an object and match them against another creature. It consists of an inkpad, parchment, and talcum powder.

item.name: Necronomicon
item.reqAttune: by a DC 20 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB} check)
entries: The most infamous of mythos tomes, the Necronomicon contains within its pages untold secrets of the mythos.

entries.name: Language:
entries: {@language Infernal|XPHB}.

entries.name: Attunement Check:
entries: Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB}) DC 20. To end your {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} to the Necronomicon, you must defeat a mythos deity in combat.

entries.name: Benefits:
entries: While attuned to the Necronomicon, you gain the following benefits:

items: You double your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} if it applies to an Intelligence check.
You can read and write {@language Abyssal|XPHB}, {@language Celestial|XPHB}, {@language Draconic|XPHB}, and {@language Primordial|XPHB}.

If you can cast spells, you always have {@spell Evil Eye|CthulhuTorchlight}, {@spell Dread Curse of Azathoth|CthulhuTorchlight}, {@spell Dust of Suleiman|CthulhuTorchlight}, and {@spell Voorish Sign|CthulhuTorchlight} prepared.
{@creature Ghoul|XMM|Ghouls} and {@creature Ghast|XMM|Ghasts} refuse to attack you unless you are first {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} toward them.
{@creature Skeleton|XMM|Skeletons} and {@creature Zombie|XMM|Zombies} obey your verbal commands.

A mythos deity attacks or otherwise attempts to harm you only if there are no other targets available for its attacks. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on all Charisma checks to sway their attitude.
If you have the spellcasting class feature, you gain one additional spell slot for each level you can use. You regain these added spell slots as normal based on your spellcasting class feature.
The save DC of your spells gains a +2 bonus.

entries.name: Drawbacks:
entries: At midnight each day roll a {@dice d20}. On a 10 or higher, you gain a Doom of the Necronomicon point. When you have 20 or more such points, you disappear into thin air, claimed by the inscrutable power that infuses this tome. The Necronomicon is the only possession you leave behind.

entries.name: Insight-Compulsion to Annihilation (+20):
entries: You are driven to meet and understand the deities of the Cthulhu Mythos. Such entities are fascinating. They are the true masters of reality, those who were and shall forever be. By understanding them, by coming in direct contact with them, you can unlock their secrets and match their power. All others failed because they were weak. I will be different. I will survive. You will see.

entries.name: Lore:
entries: The Necronomicon allows you to automatically succeed all checks made to learn about the undead and all DC 20 or lower checks made to uncover information about the mythos in general.

item.name: Pnakotic Manuscripts
item.reqAttune: by a DC 15 Intelligence ({@skill Religion|XPHB} check)
entries: The Pnakotic Manuscripts originate from a long-lost species that once walked the world, long before the rise of humans, elves, and other intelligences. These creatures communed with the Cthulhu Mythos and were perhaps their servitors. This strange tome was written before time began its proper flow and grants insights into its workings. By reading it, you learn to move between time's beats.

entries.name: Language:
entries: {@language Primordial|XPHB}.

entries.name: Attunement Check:
entries: Intelligence ({@skill Religion|XPHB}) DC 15. To end your {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} to the Pnakotic Manuscripts, you must be the target of a {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell.

entries.name: Benefits:
